Package control

Class Control

java.lang.Object
control.Control
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener
public class Control extends Object implements ActionListener
The Control class acts as a controller in the battleship game, managing user interactions, game logic, and communication.

  • Constructor Details

    • Control

      public Control(View view, Model model)
      Constructs a Control object with the associated view and model.
      Parameters:
      view - The view representing the user interface.
      model - The model containing the game logic.

  • Method Details

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener

    • handleStartButton

      public void handleStartButton()
      Handles the start button click event. Initializes the game and sets up the network communication.

    • handleEndButton

      public void handleEndButton()
      Handles the end button click event. Exits the game application.

    • openSocket

      public void openSocket(int serverPort) throws Exception
      Opens a socket for network communication and starts the game.
      Parameters:
      serverPort - The port number for the server socket.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during socket setup.

    • acceptConnection

      public void acceptConnection(int id) throws Exception
      Accepts a connection from a player, sends game data, and sets up communication.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the player (1 or 2).
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during communication setup.

    • startGame

      public void startGame() throws Exception
      Starts the game loop, handling player turns, updates, and communication.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during communication or game logic.

    • validateShot

      public boolean validateShot(int targetId, String coordinate) throws Exception
      Validates a shot fired by a player and updates game state.
      Parameters:
      targetId - The ID of the targeted player (1 or 2).
      coordinate - The coordinate at which the shot is fired.
      Returns:
      true if the shot hits a ship, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during game logic.
